verbs.description: sugarcoat (third-person singular simple present sugarcoats, present participle sugarcoating, simple past and past participle sugarcoated)

entries.meaning: (transitive, figurative) To make superficially more attractive; to give a falsely pleasant appearance to.
examples: Synonyms: gild, gild the pill, sugarcoat the pill, whitewash
There's no way to sugarcoat the loss of the space shuttle; it was an unmitigated disaster.
